port.c FreeRTOS/port.c Go to the documentation of this file.00001 /* 00002 * FreeRTOS Kernel V10.2.0 00003 * Copyright (C) 2019 Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved. 00004 * 00005 * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of 00006 * this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in 00007 * the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to 00008 * use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of 00009 * the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, 00010 * subject to the following conditions: 00011 * 00012 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all 00013 * copies or substantial portions of the Software. 00014 * 00015 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR 00016 * IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS 00017 * FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR 00018 * COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER 00019 * IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN 00020 * CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. 00021 * 00022 * http://www.FreeRTOS.org 00023 * http://aws.amazon.com/freertos 00024 * 00025 * 1 tab == 4 spaces! 00026 */ 00027 00028 /*----------------------------------------------------------- 00029 * Implementation of functions defined in portable.h for the ARM CM4F port. 00030 *----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00031 00032 /* Scheduler includes. */ 00033 #include "FreeRTOS.h" 00034 #include "task.h" 00035 #include <Arduino.h> 00036 #include <imxrt.h> 00037 00038 extern uint32_t SystemCoreClock; /* in kinetis SDK, this contains the system core clock speed */ 00039 00040 #ifndef __VFP_FP__ 00041 #error This port can only be used when the project options are configured to enable hardware floating point support. 00042 #endif 00043 00044 #ifndef configSYSTICK_CLOCK_HZ 00045 #define configSYSTICK_CLOCK_HZ configCPU_CLOCK_HZ 00046 /* Ensure the SysTick is clocked at the same frequency as the core. */ 00047 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_CLK_BIT ( 1UL << 2UL ) 00048 #else 00049 /* The way the SysTick is clocked is not modified in case it is not the same 00050 as the core. */ 00051 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_CLK_BIT ( 0 ) 00052 #endif 00053 00054 /* Constants required to manipulate the core. Registers first... */ 00055 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xe000e010 ) ) 00056 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xe000e014 ) ) 00057 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xe000e018 ) ) 00058 #define portNVIC_SYSPRI2_REG ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xe000ed20 ) ) 00059 /* ...then bits in the registers. */ 00060 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_INT_BIT ( 1UL << 1UL ) 00061 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_ENABLE_BIT ( 1UL << 0UL ) 00062 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_COUNT_FLAG_BIT ( 1UL << 16UL ) 00063 #define portNVIC_PENDSVCLEAR_BIT ( 1UL << 27UL ) 00064 #define portNVIC_PEND_SYSTICK_CLEAR_BIT ( 1UL << 25UL ) 00065 00066 /* Constants used to detect a Cortex-M7 r0p1 core, which should use the ARM_CM7 00067 r0p1 port. */ 00068 #define portCPUID ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xE000ed00 ) ) 00069 #define portCORTEX_M7_r0p1_ID ( 0x410FC271UL ) 00070 #define portCORTEX_M7_r0p0_ID ( 0x410FC270UL ) 00071 00072 #define portNVIC_PENDSV_PRI ( ( ( uint32_t ) configKERNEL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY ) << 16UL ) 00073 #define portNVIC_SYSTICK_PRI ( ( ( uint32_t ) configKERNEL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY ) << 24UL ) 00074 00075 /* Constants required to check the validity of an interrupt priority. */ 00076 #define portFIRST_USER_INTERRUPT_NUMBER ( 16 ) 00077 #define portNVIC_IP_REGISTERS_OFFSET_16 ( 0xE000E3F0 ) 00078 #define portAIRCR_REG ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xE000ED0C ) ) 00079 #define portMAX_8_BIT_VALUE ( ( uint8_t ) 0xff ) 00080 #define portTOP_BIT_OF_BYTE ( ( uint8_t ) 0x80 ) 00081 #define portMAX_PRIGROUP_BITS ( ( uint8_t ) 7 ) 00082 #define portPRIORITY_GROUP_MASK ( 0x07UL << 8UL ) 00083 #define portPRIGROUP_SHIFT ( 8UL ) 00084 00085 /* Masks off all bits but the VECTACTIVE bits in the ICSR register. */ 00086 #define portVECTACTIVE_MASK ( 0xFFUL ) 00087 00088 /* Constants required to manipulate the VFP. */ 00089 #define portFPCCR ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xe000ef34 ) /* Floating point context control register. */ 00090 #define portASPEN_AND_LSPEN_BITS ( 0x3UL << 30UL ) 00091 00092 /* Constants required to set up the initial stack. */ 00093 #define portINITIAL_XPSR ( 0x01000000 ) 00094 #define portINITIAL_EXC_RETURN ( 0xfffffffd ) 00095 00096 /* The systick is a 24-bit counter. */ 00097 #define portMAX_24_BIT_NUMBER ( 0xffffffUL ) 00098 00099 /* For strict compliance with the Cortex-M spec the task start address should 00100 have bit-0 clear, as it is loaded into the PC on exit from an ISR. */ 00101 #define portSTART_ADDRESS_MASK ( ( StackType_t ) 0xfffffffeUL ) 00102 00103 /* A fiddle factor to estimate the number of SysTick counts that would have 00104 occurred while the SysTick counter is stopped during tickless idle 00105 calculations. */ 00106 #define portMISSED_COUNTS_FACTOR ( 45UL ) 00107 00108 /* Let the user override the pre-loading of the initial LR with the address of 00109 prvTaskExitError() in case it messes up unwinding of the stack in the 00110 debugger. */ 00111 #ifdef configTASK_RETURN_ADDRESS 00112 #define portTASK_RETURN_ADDRESS configTASK_RETURN_ADDRESS 00113 #else 00114 #define portTASK_RETURN_ADDRESS prvTaskExitError 00115 #endif 00116 00117 /* 00118 * Setup the timer to generate the tick interrupts. The implementation in this 00119 * file is weak to allow application writers to change the timer used to 00120 * generate the tick interrupt. 00121 */ 00122 void vPortSetupTimerInterrupt( void ); 00123 00124 /* 00125 * Exception handlers. 00126 */ 00127 void xPortPendSVHandler( void ) __attribute__ (( naked )); 00128 void vPortSVCHandler( void ) __attribute__ (( naked )); 00129 void freertos_systick_isr(void) __attribute__((__hot__, __optimize__(3))); 00130 00131 /* 00132 * Start first task is a separate function so it can be tested in isolation. 00133 */ 00134 static void prvPortStartFirstTask( void ) __attribute__ (( naked )); 00135 00136 /* 00137 * Function to enable the VFP. 00138 */ 00139 static void vPortEnableVFP( void ) __attribute__ (( naked )); 00140 00141 /* 00142 * Function to disable the VFP. 00143 */ 00144 static void vPortDisableVFP( void ) __attribute__ (( naked )); 00145 00146 00147 /* 00148 * Used to catch tasks that attempt to return from their implementing function. 00149 */ 00150 static void prvTaskExitError( void ); 00151 00152 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00153 00154 /* Each task maintains its own interrupt status in the critical nesting 00155 variable. */ 00156 static UBaseType_t uxCriticalNesting = 0xaaaaaaaa; 00157 00158 static uint8_t portFreeRTOSSchedulerStarted = 0; 00159 00160 /* 00161 * The number of SysTick increments that make up one tick period. 00162 */ 00163 #if( configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE == 1 ) 00164 static uint32_t ulTimerCountsForOneTick = 0; 00165 #endif /* configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE */ 00166 00167 /* 00168 * The maximum number of tick periods that can be suppressed is limited by the 00169 * 24 bit resolution of the SysTick timer. 00170 */ 00171 #if( configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE == 1 ) 00172 static uint32_t xMaximumPossibleSuppressedTicks = 0; 00173 #endif /* configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE */ 00174 00175 /* 00176 * Compensate for the CPU cycles that pass while the SysTick is stopped (low 00177 * power functionality only. 00178 */ 00179 #if( configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE == 1 ) 00180 static uint32_t ulStoppedTimerCompensation = 0; 00181 #endif /* configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE */ 00182 00183 /* 00184 * Used by the portASSERT_IF_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY_INVALID() macro to ensure 00185 * FreeRTOS API functions are not called from interrupts that have been assigned 00186 * a priority above configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY. 00187 */ 00188 #if( configASSERT_DEFINED == 1 ) 00189 static uint8_t ucMaxSysCallPriority = 0; 00190 static uint32_t ulMaxPRIGROUPValue = 0; 00191 static const volatile uint8_t * const pcInterruptPriorityRegisters = ( const volatile uint8_t * const ) portNVIC_IP_REGISTERS_OFFSET_16; 00192 #endif /* configASSERT_DEFINED */ 00193 00194 #if configGENERATE_RUN_TIME_STATS == 1 00195 00196 volatile uint64_t ulTimerCounter; 00197 static void vPortRuntimeTimerCallback() { 00198 FLEXPWM2_SM2STS = FLEXPWM_SMSTS_RF; 00199 ulTimerCounter += 1; 00200 return; 00201 } 00202 00203 void vPortSetupRuntimeTimer() { 00204 uint32_t period = (float)F_BUS_ACTUAL * (float)(100000/configTICK_RATE_HZ) * 0.0000005f; 00205 uint32_t prescale = 0; 00206 while (period > 32767) { 00207 period = period >> 1; 00208 if (++prescale > 7) { 00209 prescale = 7; // when F_BUS is 150 MHz, longest 00210 period = 32767; // period is 55922 us (~17.9 Hz) 00211 break; 00212 } 00213 } 00214 FLEXPWM2_FCTRL0 |= FLEXPWM_FCTRL0_FLVL(4); // logic high = fault 00215 FLEXPWM2_FSTS0 = 0x0008; // clear fault status 00216 FLEXPWM2_MCTRL |= FLEXPWM_MCTRL_CLDOK(4); 00217 FLEXPWM2_SM2CTRL2 = FLEXPWM_SMCTRL2_INDEP; 00218 FLEXPWM2_SM2CTRL = FLEXPWM_SMCTRL_HALF | FLEXPWM_SMCTRL_PRSC(prescale); 00219 FLEXPWM2_SM2INIT = -period; 00220 FLEXPWM2_SM2VAL0 = 0; 00221 FLEXPWM2_SM2VAL1 = period; 00222 FLEXPWM2_SM2VAL2 = 0; 00223 FLEXPWM2_SM2VAL3 = 0; 00224 FLEXPWM2_SM2VAL4 = 0; 00225 FLEXPWM2_SM2VAL5 = 0; 00226 FLEXPWM2_MCTRL |= FLEXPWM_MCTRL_LDOK(4); 00227 FLEXPWM2_MCTRL &= ~FLEXPWM_MCTRL_RUN(4); 00228 attachInterruptVector(IRQ_FLEXPWM2_2, &vPortRuntimeTimerCallback); 00229 FLEXPWM2_SM2STS = FLEXPWM_SMSTS_RF; 00230 FLEXPWM2_SM2INTEN = FLEXPWM_SMINTEN_RIE; 00231 NVIC_ENABLE_IRQ(IRQ_FLEXPWM2_2); 00232 FLEXPWM2_MCTRL |= FLEXPWM_MCTRL_RUN(4); 00233 } 00234 00235 #endif 00236 00237 00238 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00239 00240 /* 00241 * See header file for description. 00242 */ 00243 StackType_t *pxPortInitialiseStack( StackType_t *pxTopOfStack, TaskFunction_t pxCode, void *pvParameters ) 00244 { 00245 /* Simulate the stack frame as it would be created by a context switch 00246 interrupt. */ 00247 00248 /* Offset added to account for the way the MCU uses the stack on entry/exit 00249 of interrupts, and to ensure alignment. */ 00250 pxTopOfStack -= 2; 00251 00252 *pxTopOfStack = portINITIAL_XPSR; /* xPSR */ 00253 pxTopOfStack--; 00254 *pxTopOfStack = ( ( StackType_t ) pxCode ) & portSTART_ADDRESS_MASK; /* PC */ 00255 pxTopOfStack--; 00256 *pxTopOfStack = ( StackType_t ) portTASK_RETURN_ADDRESS; /* LR */ 00257 00258 /* Save code space by skipping register initialisation. */ 00259 pxTopOfStack -= 5; /* R12, R3, R2 and R1. */ 00260 *pxTopOfStack = ( StackType_t ) pvParameters; /* R0 */ 00261 00262 /* A save method is being used that requires each task to maintain its 00263 own exec return value. */ 00264 pxTopOfStack--; 00265 *pxTopOfStack = portINITIAL_EXC_RETURN; 00266 00267 pxTopOfStack -= 8; /* R11, R10, R9, R8, R7, R6, R5 and R4. */ 00268 00269 return pxTopOfStack; 00270 } 00271 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00272 00273 #if INCLUDE_vTaskEndScheduler 00274 #include <setjmp.h> 00275 static jmp_buf xJumpBuf; /* Used to restore the original context when the scheduler is ended. */ 00276 #endif 00277 00278 static void prvTaskExitError( void ) 00279 { 00280 volatile uint32_t ulDummy = 0; 00281 00282 /* A function that implements a task must not exit or attempt to return to 00283 its caller as there is nothing to return to. If a task wants to exit it 00284 should instead call vTaskDelete( NULL ). 00285 00286 Artificially force an assert() to be triggered if configASSERT() is 00287 defined, then stop here so application writers can catch the error. */ 00288 configASSERT( uxCriticalNesting == ~0UL ); 00289 portDISABLE_INTERRUPTS(); 00290 while( ulDummy == 0 ) 00291 { 00292 /* This file calls prvTaskExitError() after the scheduler has been 00293 started to remove a compiler warning about the function being defined 00294 but never called. ulDummy is used purely to quieten other warnings 00295 about code appearing after this function is called - making ulDummy 00296 volatile makes the compiler think the function could return and 00297 therefore not output an 'unreachable code' warning for code that appears 00298 after it. */ 00299 } 00300 } 00301 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00302 00303 void vPortSVCHandler( void ) 00304 { 00305 __asm volatile ( 00306 " ldr r3, pxCurrentTCBConst2 
" /* Restore the context. */ 00307 " ldr r1, [r3] 
" /* Use pxCurrentTCBConst to get the pxCurrentTCB address. */ 00308 " ldr r0, [r1] 
" /* The first item in pxCurrentTCB is the task top of stack. */ 00309 " ldmia r0!, {r4-r11, r14} 
" /* Pop the registers that are not automatically saved on exception entry and the critical nesting count. */ 00310 " msr psp, r0 
" /* Restore the task stack pointer. */ 00311 " isb 
" 00312 " mov r0, #0 
" 00313 " msr basepri, r0 
" 00314 " bx r14 
" 00315 " 
" 00316 " .align 4 
" 00317 "pxCurrentTCBConst2: .word pxCurrentTCB 
" 00318 ); 00319 } 00320 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00321 00322 static void prvPortStartFirstTask( void ) 00323 { 00324 /* Start the first task. This also clears the bit that indicates the FPU is 00325 in use in case the FPU was used before the scheduler was started - which 00326 would otherwise result in the unnecessary leaving of space in the SVC stack 00327 for lazy saving of FPU registers. */ 00328 __asm volatile( 00329 #if !INCLUDE_vTaskEndScheduler 00330 " ldr r0, =0xE000ED08 
" /* Use the NVIC offset register to locate the stack. */ 00331 " ldr r0, [r0] 
" 00332 " ldr r0, [r0] 
" 00333 " msr msp, r0 
" /* Set the msp back to the start of the stack. */ 00334 " mov r0, #0 
" /* Clear the bit that indicates the FPU is in use, see comment above. */ 00335 " msr control, r0 
" 00336 #endif 00337 " cpsie i 
" /* Globally enable interrupts. */ 00338 " cpsie f 
" 00339 " dsb 
" 00340 " isb 
" 00341 " svc 0 
" /* System call to start first task. */ 00342 " nop 
" 00343 ); 00344 } 00345 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00346 00347 /* 00348 * See header file for description. 00349 */ 00350 BaseType_t xPortStartScheduler( void ) 00351 { 00352 /* configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY must not be set to 0. 00353 See http://www.FreeRTOS.org/RTOS-Cortex-M3-M4.html */ 00354 configASSERT( configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY ); 00355 00356 /* This port can be used on all revisions of the Cortex-M7 core other than 00357 the r0p1 parts. r0p1 parts should use the port from the 00358 /source/portable/GCC/ARM_CM7/r0p1 directory. */ 00359 configASSERT( portCPUID != portCORTEX_M7_r0p1_ID ); 00360 configASSERT( portCPUID != portCORTEX_M7_r0p0_ID ); 00361 00362 configASSERT( configTICK_RATE_HZ > 0 ); 00363 00364 delay(100); 00365 00366 #if( configASSERT_DEFINED == 1 ) 00367 { 00368 volatile uint32_t ulOriginalPriority; 00369 volatile uint8_t * const pucFirstUserPriorityRegister = ( volatile uint8_t * const ) ( portNVIC_IP_REGISTERS_OFFSET_16 + portFIRST_USER_INTERRUPT_NUMBER ); 00370 volatile uint8_t ucMaxPriorityValue; 00371 00372 /* Determine the maximum priority from which ISR safe FreeRTOS API 00373 functions can be called. ISR safe functions are those that end in 00374 "FromISR". FreeRTOS maintains separate thread and ISR API functions to 00375 ensure interrupt entry is as fast and simple as possible. 00376 00377 Save the interrupt priority value that is about to be clobbered. */ 00378 ulOriginalPriority = *pucFirstUserPriorityRegister; 00379 00380 /* Determine the number of priority bits available. First write to all 00381 possible bits. */ 00382 *pucFirstUserPriorityRegister = portMAX_8_BIT_VALUE; 00383 00384 /* Read the value back to see how many bits stuck. */ 00385 ucMaxPriorityValue = *pucFirstUserPriorityRegister; 00386 00387 /* Use the same mask on the maximum system call priority. */ 00388 ucMaxSysCallPriority = configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY & ucMaxPriorityValue; 00389 00390 /* Calculate the maximum acceptable priority group value for the number 00391 of bits read back. */ 00392 ulMaxPRIGROUPValue = portMAX_PRIGROUP_BITS; 00393 while( ( ucMaxPriorityValue & portTOP_BIT_OF_BYTE ) == portTOP_BIT_OF_BYTE ) 00394 { 00395 ulMaxPRIGROUPValue--; 00396 ucMaxPriorityValue <<= ( uint8_t ) 0x01; 00397 } 00398 00399 #ifdef __NVIC_PRIO_BITS 00400 { 00401 /* Check the CMSIS configuration that defines the number of 00402 priority bits matches the number of priority bits actually queried 00403 from the hardware. */ 00404 configASSERT( ( portMAX_PRIGROUP_BITS - ulMaxPRIGROUPValue ) == __NVIC_PRIO_BITS ); 00405 } 00406 #endif 00407 00408 #ifdef configPRIO_BITS 00409 { 00410 /* Check the FreeRTOS configuration that defines the number of 00411 priority bits matches the number of priority bits actually queried 00412 from the hardware. */ 00413 configASSERT( ( portMAX_PRIGROUP_BITS - ulMaxPRIGROUPValue ) == configPRIO_BITS ); 00414 } 00415 #endif 00416 00417 /* Shift the priority group value back to its position within the AIRCR 00418 register. */ 00419 ulMaxPRIGROUPValue <<= portPRIGROUP_SHIFT; 00420 ulMaxPRIGROUPValue &= portPRIORITY_GROUP_MASK; 00421 00422 /* Restore the clobbered interrupt priority register to its original 00423 value. */ 00424 *pucFirstUserPriorityRegister = ulOriginalPriority; 00425 } 00426 #endif /* conifgASSERT_DEFINED */ 00427 00428 /* Make PendSV and SysTick the lowest priority interrupts. */ 00429 portNVIC_SYSPRI2_REG |= portNVIC_PENDSV_PRI; 00430 portNVIC_SYSPRI2_REG |= portNVIC_SYSTICK_PRI; 00431 00432 /* Start the timer that generates the tick ISR. Interrupts are disabled 00433 here already. */ 00434 vPortSetupTimerInterrupt(); 00435 00436 /* Initialise the critical nesting count ready for the first task. */ 00437 uxCriticalNesting = 0; 00438 00439 vPortDisableVFP(); 00440 00441 /* Lazy save always. */ 00442 *( portFPCCR ) |= portASPEN_AND_LSPEN_BITS; 00443 00444 vPortEnableVFP(); 00445 00446 #if INCLUDE_vTaskEndScheduler 00447 if(setjmp(xJumpBuf) != 0 ) { 00448 /* here we will get in case of call to vTaskEndScheduler() */ 00449 __asm volatile( 00450 " movs r0, #1 
" /* Switch back to the MSP stack. */ 00451 " msr CONTROL, r0 
" 00452 ); 00453 __asm volatile("dsb"); 00454 __asm volatile("isb"); 00455 return pdFALSE; 00456 } 00457 #endif 00458 00459 /* Start the first task. */ 00460 prvPortStartFirstTask(); 00461 00462 /* Should never get here as the tasks will now be executing! Call the task 00463 exit error function to prevent compiler warnings about a static function 00464 not being called in the case that the application writer overrides this 00465 functionality by defining configTASK_RETURN_ADDRESS. Call 00466 vTaskSwitchContext() so link time optimisation does not remove the 00467 symbol. */ 00468 vTaskSwitchContext(); 00469 prvTaskExitError(); 00470 00471 /* Should not get here! */ 00472 return 0; 00473 } 00474 00475 static void vPortDisableVFP( void ){ 00476 __asm volatile( 00477 " mov r0, #0 
" /* Clear the bit that indicates the FPU is in use*/ 00478 " msr control, r0 " 00479 ); 00480 00481 ( * ( ( volatile uint32_t * ) 0xE000ED88 ) ) &= 0xff0fffff; 00482 00483 __asm volatile( 00484 " dsb 
" 00485 " isb 
" 00486 " bx r14 " 00487 ); 00488 } 00489 00490 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00491 void vPortEndScheduler(void) { 00492 /* stop tick timer */ 00493 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG = portNVIC_SYSTICK_CLK_BIT | portNVIC_SYSTICK_INT_BIT; 00494 /* Jump back to the processor state prior to starting the 00495 scheduler. This means we are not going to be using a 00496 task stack frame so the task can be deleted. */ 00497 #if INCLUDE_vTaskEndScheduler 00498 longjmp(xJumpBuf, 1); 00499 #else 00500 for(;;){} /* wait here */ 00501 #endif 00502 } 00503 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00504 00505 void vPortEnterCritical( void ) 00506 { 00507 if(portFreeRTOSSchedulerStarted) portDISABLE_INTERRUPTS(); 00508 uxCriticalNesting++; 00509 00510 /* This is not the interrupt safe version of the enter critical function so 00511 assert() if it is being called from an interrupt context. Only API 00512 functions that end in "FromISR" can be used in an interrupt. Only assert if 00513 the critical nesting count is 1 to protect against recursive calls if the 00514 assert function also uses a critical section. */ 00515 if( uxCriticalNesting == 1 ) 00516 { 00517 configASSERT( ( portNVIC_INT_CTRL_REG & portVECTACTIVE_MASK ) == 0 ); 00518 } 00519 } 00520 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00521 00522 void vPortExitCritical( void ) 00523 { 00524 configASSERT( uxCriticalNesting ); 00525 uxCriticalNesting--; 00526 if( uxCriticalNesting == 0 && portFreeRTOSSchedulerStarted ) 00527 { 00528 portENABLE_INTERRUPTS(); 00529 } 00530 } 00531 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00532 extern void pendablesrvreq_isr(); 00533 void xPortPendSVHandler( void ) 00534 { 00535 //pendablesrvreq_isr(); 00536 __asm volatile 00537 ( 00538 " mrs r0, psp 
" 00539 " isb 
" 00540 " 
" 00541 " ldr r3, pxCurrentTCBConst 
" /* Get the location of the current TCB. */ 00542 " ldr r2, [r3] 
" 00543 " 
" 00544 " tst r14, #0x10 
" /* Is the task using the FPU context? If so, push high vfp registers. */ 00545 " it eq 
" 00546 " vstmdbeq r0!, {s16-s31} 
" 00547 " 
" 00548 " stmdb r0!, {r4-r11, r14} 
" /* Save the core registers. */ 00549 " str r0, [r2] 
" /* Save the new top of stack into the first member of the TCB. */ 00550 " 
" 00551 " stmdb sp!, {r0, r3} 
" 00552 " mov r0, %0 
" 00553 " msr basepri, r0 
" 00554 " dsb 
" 00555 " isb 
" 00556 " bl vTaskSwitchContext 
" 00557 " mov r0, #0 
" 00558 " msr basepri, r0 
" 00559 " ldmia sp!, {r0, r3} 
" 00560 " 
" 00561 " ldr r1, [r3] 
" /* The first item in pxCurrentTCB is the task top of stack. */ 00562 " ldr r0, [r1] 
" 00563 " 
" 00564 " ldmia r0!, {r4-r11, r14} 
" /* Pop the core registers. */ 00565 " 
" 00566 " tst r14, #0x10 
" /* Is the task using the FPU context? If so, pop the high vfp registers too. */ 00567 " it eq 
" 00568 " vldmiaeq r0!, {s16-s31} 
" 00569 " 
" 00570 " msr psp, r0 
" 00571 " dsb 
" 00572 " isb 
" 00573 " 
" 00574 #ifdef WORKAROUND_PMU_CM001 /* XMC4000 specific errata workaround. */ 00575 #if WORKAROUND_PMU_CM001 == 1 00576 " push { r14 } 
" 00577 " pop { pc } 
" 00578 #endif 00579 #endif 00580 " 
" 00581 " bx r14 
" 00582 " 
" 00583 " .align 4 
" 00584 "pxCurrentTCBConst: .word pxCurrentTCB 
" 00585 ::"i"(configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY) 00586 ); 00587 } 00588 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00589 00590 extern void systick_isr(void); 00591 void freertos_systick_isr(void) 00592 { 00593 static uint8_t sub_tick_cnt = 0; 00594 sub_tick_cnt++; 00595 00596 if(configTICK_RATE_HZ >= 1000) { // FreeRTOS is too fast 00597 if(sub_tick_cnt >= configTICK_RATE_HZ/1000) { 00598 systick_isr(); 00599 sub_tick_cnt = 0; 00600 } 00601 } else { // FreeRTOS is too slow 00602 if(1000 % configTICK_RATE_HZ) { // Using the configTICK_RATE_HZ Hz systick 00603 static uint32_t r = 0; 00604 r += 1000 / configTICK_RATE_HZ; 00605 for(uint32_t i=r ; i > 0 ; i--) { 00606 systick_isr(); 00607 r -= 1; 00608 } 00609 } else { //In this case, we are using the 1kHz systick 00610 systick_isr(); 00611 if(sub_tick_cnt < 1000/configTICK_RATE_HZ) { 00612 return; 00613 } 00614 } 00615 00616 sub_tick_cnt = 0; 00617 } 00618 00619 portSET_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR(); 00620 { 00621 /* Increment the RTOS tick. */ 00622 if( xTaskIncrementTick() != pdFALSE ) 00623 { 00624 /* A context switch is required. Context switching is performed in 00625 the PendSV interrupt. Pend the PendSV interrupt. */ 00626 portNVIC_INT_CTRL_REG = portNVIC_PENDSVSET_BIT; 00627 } 00628 } 00629 portCLEAR_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR(0); 00630 00631 } 00632 00633 00634 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00635 00636 #if( configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE == 1 ) 00637 00638 __attribute__((weak)) void vPortSuppressTicksAndSleep( TickType_t xExpectedIdleTime ) 00639 { 00640 uint32_t ulReloadValue, ulCompleteTickPeriods, ulCompletedSysTickDecrements; 00641 TickType_t xModifiableIdleTime; 00642 00643 /* Make sure the SysTick reload value does not overflow the counter. */ 00644 if( xExpectedIdleTime > xMaximumPossibleSuppressedTicks ) 00645 { 00646 xExpectedIdleTime = xMaximumPossibleSuppressedTicks; 00647 } 00648 00649 /* Stop the SysTick momentarily. The time the SysTick is stopped for 00650 is accounted for as best it can be, but using the tickless mode will 00651 inevitably result in some tiny drift of the time maintained by the 00652 kernel with respect to calendar time. */ 00653 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG &= ~portNVIC_SYSTICK_ENABLE_BIT; 00654 00655 /* Calculate the reload value required to wait xExpectedIdleTime 00656 tick periods. -1 is used because this code will execute part way 00657 through one of the tick periods. */ 00658 ulReloadValue = portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG + ( ulTimerCountsForOneTick * ( xExpectedIdleTime - 1UL ) ); 00659 if( ulReloadValue > ulStoppedTimerCompensation ) 00660 { 00661 ulReloadValue -= ulStoppedTimerCompensation; 00662 } 00663 00664 /* Enter a critical section but don't use the taskENTER_CRITICAL() 00665 method as that will mask interrupts that should exit sleep mode. */ 00666 __asm volatile( "cpsid i" ::: "memory" ); 00667 __asm volatile( "dsb" ); 00668 __asm volatile( "isb" ); 00669 00670 /* If a context switch is pending or a task is waiting for the scheduler 00671 to be unsuspended then abandon the low power entry. */ 00672 if( eTaskConfirmSleepModeStatus() == eAbortSleep ) 00673 { 00674 /* Restart from whatever is left in the count register to complete 00675 this tick period. */ 00676 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG = portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG; 00677 00678 /* Restart SysTick. */ 00679 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG |= portNVIC_SYSTICK_ENABLE_BIT; 00680 00681 /* Reset the reload register to the value required for normal tick 00682 periods. */ 00683 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG = ulTimerCountsForOneTick - 1UL; 00684 00685 /* Re-enable interrupts - see comments above the cpsid instruction() 00686 above. */ 00687 __asm volatile( "cpsie i" ::: "memory" ); 00688 } 00689 else 00690 { 00691 /* Set the new reload value. */ 00692 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG = ulReloadValue; 00693 00694 /* Clear the SysTick count flag and set the count value back to 00695 zero. */ 00696 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG = 0UL; 00697 00698 /* Restart SysTick. */ 00699 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG |= portNVIC_SYSTICK_ENABLE_BIT; 00700 00701 /* Sleep until something happens. configPRE_SLEEP_PROCESSING() can 00702 set its parameter to 0 to indicate that its implementation contains 00703 its own wait for interrupt or wait for event instruction, and so wfi 00704 should not be executed again. However, the original expected idle 00705 time variable must remain unmodified, so a copy is taken. */ 00706 xModifiableIdleTime = xExpectedIdleTime; 00707 configPRE_SLEEP_PROCESSING( xModifiableIdleTime ); 00708 if( xModifiableIdleTime > 0 ) 00709 { 00710 __asm volatile( "dsb" ::: "memory" ); 00711 __asm volatile( "wfi" ); 00712 __asm volatile( "isb" ); 00713 } 00714 configPOST_SLEEP_PROCESSING( xExpectedIdleTime ); 00715 00716 /* Re-enable interrupts to allow the interrupt that brought the MCU 00717 out of sleep mode to execute immediately. see comments above 00718 __disable_interrupt() call above. */ 00719 __asm volatile( "cpsie i" ::: "memory" ); 00720 __asm volatile( "dsb" ); 00721 __asm volatile( "isb" ); 00722 00723 /* Disable interrupts again because the clock is about to be stopped 00724 and interrupts that execute while the clock is stopped will increase 00725 any slippage between the time maintained by the RTOS and calendar 00726 time. */ 00727 __asm volatile( "cpsid i" ::: "memory" ); 00728 __asm volatile( "dsb" ); 00729 __asm volatile( "isb" ); 00730 00731 /* Disable the SysTick clock without reading the 00732 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG register to ensure the 00733 portNVIC_SYSTICK_COUNT_FLAG_BIT is not cleared if it is set. Again, 00734 the time the SysTick is stopped for is accounted for as best it can 00735 be, but using the tickless mode will inevitably result in some tiny 00736 drift of the time maintained by the kernel with respect to calendar 00737 time*/ 00738 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG = ( portNVIC_SYSTICK_CLK_BIT | portNVIC_SYSTICK_INT_BIT ); 00739 00740 /* Determine if the SysTick clock has already counted to zero and 00741 been set back to the current reload value (the reload back being 00742 correct for the entire expected idle time) or if the SysTick is yet 00743 to count to zero (in which case an interrupt other than the SysTick 00744 must have brought the system out of sleep mode). */ 00745 if( ( portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG & portNVIC_SYSTICK_COUNT_FLAG_BIT ) != 0 ) 00746 { 00747 uint32_t ulCalculatedLoadValue; 00748 00749 /* The tick interrupt is already pending, and the SysTick count 00750 reloaded with ulReloadValue. Reset the 00751 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG with whatever remains of this tick 00752 period. */ 00753 ulCalculatedLoadValue = ( ulTimerCountsForOneTick - 1UL ) - ( ulReloadValue - portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG ); 00754 00755 /* Don't allow a tiny value, or values that have somehow 00756 underflowed because the post sleep hook did something 00757 that took too long. */ 00758 if( ( ulCalculatedLoadValue < ulStoppedTimerCompensation ) || ( ulCalculatedLoadValue > ulTimerCountsForOneTick ) ) 00759 { 00760 ulCalculatedLoadValue = ( ulTimerCountsForOneTick - 1UL ); 00761 } 00762 00763 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG = ulCalculatedLoadValue; 00764 00765 /* As the pending tick will be processed as soon as this 00766 function exits, the tick value maintained by the tick is stepped 00767 forward by one less than the time spent waiting. */ 00768 ulCompleteTickPeriods = xExpectedIdleTime - 1UL; 00769 } 00770 else 00771 { 00772 /* Something other than the tick interrupt ended the sleep. 00773 Work out how long the sleep lasted rounded to complete tick 00774 periods (not the ulReload value which accounted for part 00775 ticks). */ 00776 ulCompletedSysTickDecrements = ( xExpectedIdleTime * ulTimerCountsForOneTick ) - portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG; 00777 00778 /* How many complete tick periods passed while the processor 00779 was waiting? */ 00780 ulCompleteTickPeriods = ulCompletedSysTickDecrements / ulTimerCountsForOneTick; 00781 00782 /* The reload value is set to whatever fraction of a single tick 00783 period remains. */ 00784 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG = ( ( ulCompleteTickPeriods + 1UL ) * ulTimerCountsForOneTick ) - ulCompletedSysTickDecrements; 00785 } 00786 00787 /* Restart SysTick so it runs from portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG 00788 again, then set portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG back to its standard 00789 value. */ 00790 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CURRENT_VALUE_REG = 0UL; 00791 portNVIC_SYSTICK_CTRL_REG |= portNVIC_SYSTICK_ENABLE_BIT; 00792 vTaskStepTick( ulCompleteTickPeriods ); 00793 portNVIC_SYSTICK_LOAD_REG = ulTimerCountsForOneTick - 1UL; 00794 00795 /* Exit with interrpts enabled. */ 00796 __asm volatile( "cpsie i" ::: "memory" ); 00797 } 00798 } 00799 00800 #endif /* #if configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE */ 00801 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00802 00803 /* 00804 * Setup the systick timer to generate the tick interrupts at the required 00805 * frequency. 00806 */ 00807 void vPortSetupTimerInterrupt( void ) 00808 { 00809 portFreeRTOSSchedulerStarted = 1; 00810 portDISABLE_INTERRUPTS(); 00811 00812 if((configTICK_RATE_HZ >= 1000) || (1000 % configTICK_RATE_HZ)) { // 1000 cannot be divided by configTICK_RATE_HZ, we cannnot use the standard 1kHz systick for the FreeRTOS tick 00813 SYST_RVR = (100000 / configTICK_RATE_HZ) - 1; 00814 } 00815 00816 _VectorsRam[15] = freertos_systick_isr; 00817 _VectorsRam[14] = xPortPendSVHandler; 00818 _VectorsRam[11] = vPortSVCHandler; 00819 portENABLE_INTERRUPTS(); 00820 } 00821 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00822 00823 /* This is a naked function. */ 00824 static void vPortEnableVFP( void ) 00825 { 00826 __asm volatile 00827 ( 00828 " ldr.w r0, =0xE000ED88 
" /* The FPU enable bits are in the CPACR. */ 00829 " ldr r1, [r0] 
" 00830 " 
" 00831 " orr r1, r1, #( 0xf << 20 ) 
" /* Enable CP10 and CP11 coprocessors, then save back. */ 00832 " str r1, [r0] 
" 00833 " bx r14 " 00834 ); 00835 } 00836 /*-----------------------------------------------------------*/ 00837 00838 #if( configASSERT_DEFINED == 1 ) 00839 00840 void vPortValidateInterruptPriority( void ) 00841 { 00842 uint32_t ulCurrentInterrupt; 00843 uint8_t ucCurrentPriority; 00844 00845 /* Obtain the number of the currently executing interrupt. */ 00846 __asm volatile( "mrs %0, ipsr" : "=r"( ulCurrentInterrupt ) :: "memory" ); 00847 00848 /* Is the interrupt number a user defined interrupt? */ 00849 if( ulCurrentInterrupt >= portFIRST_USER_INTERRUPT_NUMBER ) 00850 { 00851 /* Look up the interrupt's priority. */ 00852 ucCurrentPriority = pcInterruptPriorityRegisters[ ulCurrentInterrupt ]; 00853 00854 /* The following assertion will fail if a service routine (ISR) for 00855 an interrupt that has been assigned a priority above 00856 configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY calls an ISR safe FreeRTOS API 00857 function. ISR safe FreeRTOS API functions must *only* be called 00858 from interrupts that have been assigned a priority at or below 00859 configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY. 00860 00861 Numerically low interrupt priority numbers represent logically high 00862 interrupt priorities, therefore the priority of the interrupt must 00863 be set to a value equal to or numerically *higher* than 00864 configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY. 00865 00866 Interrupts that use the FreeRTOS API must not be left at their 00867 default priority of zero as that is the highest possible priority, 00868 which is guaranteed to be above configMAX_SYSCALL_INTERRUPT_PRIORITY, 00869 and therefore also guaranteed to be invalid. 00870 00871 FreeRTOS maintains separate thread and ISR API functions to ensure 00872 interrupt entry is as fast and simple as possible. 00873 00874 The following links provide detailed information: 00875 http://www.freertos.org/RTOS-Cortex-M3-M4.html 00876 http://www.freertos.org/FAQHelp.html */ 00877 configASSERT( ucCurrentPriority >= ucMaxSysCallPriority ); 00878 } 00879 00880 /* Priority grouping: The interrupt controller (NVIC) allows the bits 00881 that define each interrupt's priority to be split between bits that 00882 define the interrupt's pre-emption priority bits and bits that define 00883 the interrupt's sub-priority. For simplicity all bits must be defined 00884 to be pre-emption priority bits. The following assertion will fail if 00885 this is not the case (if some bits represent a sub-priority). 00886 00887 If the application only uses CMSIS libraries for interrupt 00888 configuration then the correct setting can be achieved on all Cortex-M 00889 devices by calling NVIC_SetPriorityGrouping( 0 ); before starting the 00890 scheduler. Note however that some vendor specific peripheral libraries 00891 assume a non-zero priority group setting, in which cases using a value 00892 of zero will result in unpredictable behaviour. */ 00893 configASSERT( ( portAIRCR_REG & portPRIORITY_GROUP_MASK ) <= ulMaxPRIGROUPValue ); 00894 } 00895 00896 #endif /* configASSERT_DEFINED */ 00897
